metadata.Title: CVE-2018-25032 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
zlib before 1.2.12 allows memory corruption when deflating (i.e., when compressing) if the input has many distant matches.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-25032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

rsync - 3.1.1-3ubuntu1.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

lib32z1 - 1:1.2.8.dfsg-2ubuntu4.3+esm1
lib64z1 - 1:1.2.8.dfsg-2ubuntu4.3+esm1
libx32z1 - 1:1.2.8.dfsg-2ubuntu4.3+esm1
zlib1g - 1:1.2.8.dfsg-2ubuntu4.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> since 3.1.3-7, rsync builds with the system zlib

criterions.comment: rsync package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.1-3ubuntu1.3+esm1').
zlib package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.2.8.dfsg-2ubuntu4.3+esm1').
